name: df-wlkson
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cwlkson, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), copab(s3, s4, w3a(wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cwlks, cv(s0)), cv(s4)), wceq(cfv(cv(s4), nat0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s4), cfv(chash, cv(s3))), cv(s2)))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ WalksOn =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0), s2 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0)‚Ü¶ { < s3, s4 > |(s3[(Walks ` s0)]s4 ‚àß(s4 ` 0)= s1 ‚àß(s4 `(# ` s3))= s2)}))
comment: Define the collection of walks with particular endpoints (in a hypergraph). The predicate ` F ( A ( WalksOn `` G ) B ) P ` can be read as "The pair ` <. F , P >. ` represents a walk from vertex ` A ` to vertex ` B ` in a graph ` G ` ", see also ~ iswlkon . This corresponds to the "x0-x(l)-walks", see Definition in [Bollobas] p. 5. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens and Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 28-Dec-2020.)
